title: Bug AS
text:
Bug AS is a Norwegian production company established in 1995, by Gunnar Larsen in <a href="Bergen">Bergen</a>, <a href="Norway">Norway</a>. In its startup period the company produced industrial 3d, Still Vizualisation and Camera point of view walkthrougs. Later such as idents for <a href="TV">TV</a> <a href="commercials">commercials</a> and company presentations.
In 2001 Bug AS was sold and became a subsidiary of <a href="Unique%20X">Unique X</a>.
In 2006 Bug AS was bought by Ladybird AS and DLS Consult AS and re-established itself as an own independent full-service production company offering a full specter of services ranging from <a href="design">design</a>, creative idea, <a href="animation">animation</a>, <a href="3-D%20film">3D</a> and <a href="Two-dimensional">2D</a>, <a href="motion%20graphics">motion graphics</a>, <a href="sound%20design">sound design</a>, <a href="post%20production">post production</a>, <a href="Computer-generated%20imagery">CGI</a>, <a href="VFX">VFX</a>, stereoscopic 3D films, digital cinema mastering, digital cinema distribution, business presentations, games, <a href="webisodes">webisodes</a>, <a href="idents">idents</a>, <a href="vignetting">vignettes</a>, promo graphics to interactive <a href="web%20design">web design</a>.
It is a Norwegian design studio creating motion graphics, visual effects and 3D animation for film, broadcast and commercials, as well as post production and editing in SD and HD. The company is responsible for the encoding and distribution of commercials to Unique Digital's digital cinema advertising networks in several European territories.
It is the production partner of <a href="CreaCon">CreaCon</a> for the animated children's TV-series City of Friends, distributed by <a href="The%20Walt%20Disney%20Company">The Walt Disney Company</a>. It has also produced visual effects and <a href="motion%20graphics">motion graphics</a> for the nightclub in <a href="Burj%20Khalifa">Burj Khalifa</a>, and was the first company ever to produce a <a href="3D%20Cinema%20Advert">3D Cinema Advert</a> for <a href="Mitsubishi">Mitsubishi</a> in 2006.
